name: q1
question: Which country group in the options below do you belong to?

name: q1a
question: What is your grade?

name: q2
question: Do you have a good understanding of the “With Integrity” Mitsui & Co. Group Conduct Guidelines?

name: q3
question: Do you have a good understanding of “Act with integrity” as part of Corporate Mission Vision Values?

name: q4
question: Do you have a good understanding of “Build an organization with integrity” as one of Mitsui & Co.’s Materiality?

name: q5
question: Do you have a good understanding of the Mitsui Business Conduct Guidelines applicable to your Bloc?

name: q6
question: On scale of 1-5 (with 1 being least aware and 5 being fully aware), how do you rate your understanding level of the internal rules (including the Business Conduct Guidelines in your Bloc) which apply to your work?

name: q7
question: On scale of 1-5 (with 1 being least aware and 5 being fully aware), how do you rate your understanding level of the laws and regulations which apply to your work?

name: q8
question: Do you know who you can consult with if you are not sure the relevant internal rules apply to your work?

name: q9
question: Do you know who you can contact if you have any compliance/integrity-related concerns?

name: q10
question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement:<q>My office is open and communicative. It is easy to exchange honest opinions, report bad or non-positive news, or ask for help on any matter.</q>

name: q10a
question: If you chose “Mostly disagree” or “Disagree” in question 10, why do you think your office is not open and communicative? Please choose one or more answers from the following options.

answers.text: My manager and the colleagues in the office in general are too busy.
My manager does not appear ready to listen to free opinions or be consulted.
My manager does not respond to other’s opinions or consultations.
The overall office atmosphere makes me feel unsafe to freely exchange opinions or consult with someone else.

name: q11
question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement:<q>The environment in my office is supportive of an open atmosphere where mutual respect among each individual is highly valued?</q>

name: q12
question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement:<q>Integrity and compliance are valued in my office in addition to work performance?</q>

name: q13_1
question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement:<q>My manager supports a culture of integrity and compliance in my office. For example, by sharing his/her own thoughts and experiences or providing the opportunity to talk about the importance of integrity and compliance.</q>

name: q13_2
question: Do you agree or disagree with the following statement:<q>The senior management in my Bloc supports a culture of integrity and compliance. For example, they share their thoughts and experiences in their own words, and give everyone a chance to talk about the importance of Integrity and Compliance.</q>

name: q14
question: <u>During the past one year,</u> have you received any request from customers or other parties that you believe was a breach of our Business Conduct Guidelines or our internal rules, or had a risk of leading to such breach? IF SO, were you able to refuse such requests?

answers.text: I have not received such requests
I received such requests but refused them.
I received such requests but was unable to refuse them and accepted such requests.

name: q14a
question: If you chose (b) or (c) in response to the question 14, what was your manager’s response when you received such requests?

answers.text: My manager told me to refuse the requests and supported me to refuse such requests.
My manager told me to refuse the requests but did not support me to refuse such requests.
My manager told me to accept such requests.
My manager made no decision whatsoever regarding such requests and gave no instructions.
I did not consult with my manager and made the decision on my own.

name: q15
question:
During the past one year, do you think there have been or might have been integrity and/or compliance-related problems in your office?
Please choose one or more answers from the following options.

answers.text: Issues related to discrimination (e.g., gender, sexuality, disability, ethnicity, nationality)
Other issues related to the office environment
Issues related to cartels or bid-rigging
Other issues related to non-compliance with competition laws
Issues related to anti-money laundering laws
Issues related to export and import procedures (e.g., customs laws)
Issues related to sanctions and export control
Issues related to industry-specific laws (e.g., REACH, RoHS)
Improper use of the company’s information systems
Issues related to side business without the company’s approval
Other issues related to conflicts of interest or keeping public and private matters separate
Issues related to gifts or entertainment for public officials (or equivalent)
Issues related to gifts or entertainment for other persons
Issues related to inappropriate use of entertainment expenses
Other issues related to gifts or entertainment
Issues related to the management of personal information
Issues related to copyright, trademark rights or other intellectual property rights
Management of insider trading information or confidential information
Inappropriate communication of information on social networking services or other media
Other issues related to information management
Issues related to non-compliance with Business Conduct Guidelines of your Bloc
Issues related to contract handling and document retention rules
Other issues related to non-compliance with internal rules
Issues related to political contributions and donations
Issues related to environmental protection laws
Issues related to organized crime groups

categories.title: < Compliance with competition and anti-money laundering laws >
< Compliance with export and import procedures and industry-specific laws >
< Compliance with accounting and tax laws and financial reporting >
< Conflicts of interest or keeping public and private matters separate >
< Issues related to environmental protection laws >
< Issues related to organized crime groups >

name: q16a
question: If you chose any issues in the question 15, do you think any issue is currently hidden in your office?

name: q16b
question: If you chose “Yes” or “Not sure” in response to the question 16A, why do you think the issues remain hidden? Please choose one answer.

answers.text: There are compliance violations in my office that are overlooked.
There are compliance violations in my office that are deliberately ignored.

name: q16c
question: If you chose “Yes” or “Not sure” in response to the question 16A, how do you feel it improved from the last year?

answers.text: It has improved but still remains a problem
It is the same situation as one year before

name: q17
question: Are you aware of the “Speak Up!” page on the intranet?

name: q18
question: Are you aware of the internal and external reporting routes available at Mitsui, including, for example, EthicsPoint?

name: q19
question: <u>During the past one year,</u> did you speak up after discovering violations of laws, Business Conduct Guidelines or internal rules by your co-workers, managers or senior colleagues?

answers.text: I have spoken up on or reported such behaviour.
I have not spoken up on or reported such behaviour.
I have not come across any such violations or behaviour.

name: q19a
question: If you chose (b) in response to question 19, what were the reason you hesitated or felt unable to speak up or report such behaviour? Please choose one or more answers.

answers.text: I didn’t think the behaviour went as far as being a compliance violation.
I don’t like the idea of secretly informing on people and blaming them.
I thought the people involved should sort it out themselves.
I was worried that I would become isolated in the office or there would be retaliation.
I thought it was an issue for the organization as a whole.
The issue was more to do with the nature and practices of the industry in question
Nothing would come of it if I did make a report or seek a consultation.
I thought there was a risk of a negative impact on sales or business performance.
I was concerned there would be a negative impact on my annual HR appraisal.
My department tends to be secretive by nature.
I didn’t know who to talk to.
I decided that it wasn’t a major problem.

name: q20
question: <u>During the past one year,</u> did you hesitate or feel unable to speak up or report any issue you were personally handling or personally involved in any way  that you suspected or believed was a compliance violation or could lead to a compliance violation?

answers.text: I have spoken up on all such issues that I faced.
I did not speak up on some issues that I faced.
I did not face any such issues.

name: q20a
question: If you chose (b) in response to the question 20, why did you hesitate or feel unable to speak up about your issue? Please choose one or more answers.

answers.text: I was frightened of being punished or creating a negative impact on my annual HR appraisal.
I thought I would solve the problem on my own.
I thought nobody would find out.
I thought it would cause trouble in my office or for my manager/colleague.
My manager or colleagues were also involved, and it was an issue for the whole organization.
It would have made my office a harder place for me to be.
I thought there was a risk of a negative impact on sales or business performance.
It has been standard industry practice.
I didn’t think it was a major problem.

name: q21
question: Please freely express your opinions or concerns (positive and/or negative) about the level of integrity and compliance awareness at your workplace <u>during the past one year</u> (including, without limitation, the possibility to speak up, the reliability and confidentiality of internal/external reporting routes or other activities in your office). We also welcome your feedback and opinions on how to improve the level of integrity and compliance awareness at Mitsui.
